roleset.name: be newly created; recently come into being
roleset.note: Default to this sense when there is ambiguity or doubt

example.name: Portlandia, all args (example 1)
example.text: The company has a new product

example.name: all args (example 2)
example.text: We will discuss new developments in the economic crisis

example.name: use this sense for new positions
example.text: Having a new leader every 4 years doesn't make a country unstable

example.name: AMR-only adverbial use
example.text: Newly married people can have trouble adjusting

example.name: AMR-only adverbial use
example.text: I just bought a new car

roleset.name: new to; novel; have an existing idea, state or circumstance apply to new targets
roleset.note: Avoid using this for newly acquired possessions, unless it is very explicit that they are not literally new.

role.descr: person/place for whom arg1 is new; experiencer of newness

example.name: locational arg2
example.text: We've been encountering this species in new areas

example.name: all args (example 2)
example.text: He is new to the idea of waking up at 5am.
example.arg: to the idea of waking up at 5am
